alert.note: Alert for Allamakee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:04AM CDT until May 04 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin...Iowa... Mississippi River at Lansing affecting Vernon, Allamakee, Houston and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting Vernon, Houston and La Crosse Counties. Mississippi River at Winona affecting Trempealeau, Winona and Buffalo Counties. Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Grant and Clayton Counties. Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Allamakee, Clayton and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at Lake City affecting Goodhue, Wabasha and Pepin Counties. .The Mississippi River has crested in our hydrologic service area and will continue to slowly fall through the week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Lansing. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.9 feet, Water from the storm sewer system reaches the 300 and 500 blocks of South Front Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 14.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 05/04/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening.
